unittitle.altrender: New York State Library School Records

did.unittitle: New York State Library School Records

physdesc.extent: 33 linear ft. (ca. 32,200 items in 91 boxes and 2 oversize flat boxes)

repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The incomplete records of the New York State Library School (NYSLS), Albany, 1890-1911. Included are diploma lists, grade sheets, examination questions, examination questions with corresponding set of students' answers, pass cards, senior certificate lists, an admissions application, entrance examinations, curriculum materials, and some documents for the class of 1890. Also, records of the New York State Library School Association, Incorporated. In addition to letters from such prominent American librarians as Katharine L. Sharp, Joseph Wheeler, Ralph Munn, and James I. Wyer, there are minutes, reports, memoranda, and printed documents, including the Association's constitution. There is a scrapbook of blanks and forms used in the executive departments of U.S. libraries in 1893, mounted by the N.Y. State Library School for the American Library Association World's Columbian Exposition Comparative Library Exhibit (Chicago, 1893). Also, files of the school consisting of course materials, exams, publications of the School, student records, admission files, class lists and rankings, and some related correspondence.

1992 Addition: Administrative records of the school consisting of correspondence, student records, including card files containing the citation of bibliographies and theses submitted by students, as well as "community studies" covering the libraries of various regions of the world. There are also records of the NYSLS Association consisting of correspondence, minutes of meetings, constitution, financial records and a selection of photographs of prominent librarians, 1886-1967.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
The records are divided into four series:
Series I
Series II: 1981 Addition
Series III: 1992 Addition
Series IV: 2005 Addition

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Material in Boxes 1 and 2 is charred and has been microfilmed. Reader must use microfilm. Originals are not to be used unless the particular frame or frames needed are illegible.
The scrapbook in Box 4 is charred and is very fragile.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition
acqinfo.p: 1971 M-71 Columbia University School of Library Service Gift
1992 M-1992 Photographs & printed misc. School of Library Service Transfer

altformavail.head: Alternate Formats
altformavail.p: Material in Boxes 1 and 2 is charred; Microfilm available.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); New York State Library School records; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. The RBML maintains ownership of the physical material only. Copyright remains with the creator and his/her heirs. The responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material-- at Columbia
relatedmaterial.p: New York State Library School Register is in the K. Brown collection, Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

otherfindaid.p: Finding aid in respository and online.

did.unittitle: American Library Association World’s Columbia Exposition Comparative Library Exhibit--Blanks and Forms Used in the Executive Departments of the Various Libraries in the United States, 1893

scopecontent.p: (1 Scrapbook. Scrapbook was charred by fire and is very fragile.)

did.unittitle: Curriculum Materials for Cataloging and Acquisitions
Diplomas arranged by faculty and class
Association of the New York State Library School Files, 1945-1957

scopecontent.p: (Box 5 contains general files; the rest of the files are arranged chronologically by semester and sub-arranged by course title)
(Box 24 includes Faculty Minutes Book, Volume 3, 1911-1924. Volumes 1-2 were destroyed in the 1911 fire.)
(Includes correspondence with Melvil Dewey and the text of the school song)

(Once file contains the alphabetized records of bibliographies and theses submitted for graduation requirements for NYSLS through 1902. The second file contains "community studies"-studies of library training in different nations and the states of the United States, arranged alphabetically.)
